content:
DataGridViewSelectedCellCollection Class

Definition

Represents a collection of cells that are selected in a DataGridView.

In this Article

[System.ComponentModel.ListBindable(false)]
public class DataGridViewSelectedCellCollection : System.Windows.Forms.BaseCollection, System.Collections.IList
Inheritance
Object
MarshalByRefObject
System.Windows.Forms.BaseCollection
DataGridViewSelectedCellCollection

Inherited Members

CreateObjRef(Type)
GetLifetimeService()
InitializeLifetimeService()
MemberwiseClone(Boolean)
Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)

MemberwiseClone()

ToString()

Count
GetEnumerator()
IsReadOnly
IsSynchronized
SyncRoot

Remarks

The order of cells in the collection is not guaranteed to match the order in which they were selected.

Properties

Item(Int32)

Gets the cell at the specified index.

public System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell this[int index] { get; }
index
Int32

The index of the DataGridViewCell to get from the DataGridViewSelectedCellCollection.

Value
DataGridViewCell

The DataGridViewCell at the specified index.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

index is less than 0.

-or-

index is equal to or greater than the number of cells in the collection.

List

Gets a list of elements in the collection.

protected override System.Collections.ArrayList List { get; }
Value
ArrayList

An ArrayList containing the elements of the collection.

Methods

Clear()

Clears the collection.

public void Clear ();
Exceptions
NotSupportedException

Always thrown.

Remarks

This method is not relevant for this class. You cannot change the DataGridViewSelectedCellCollection class directly. To clear the DataGridViewSelectedCellCollection, use the ClearSelection method.

Contains(DataGridViewCell)

Determines whether the specified cell is contained in the collection.

public bool Contains (System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell dataGridViewCell);
dataGridViewCell
DataGridViewCell

The DataGridViewCell to locate in the DataGridViewSelectedCellCollection.

Returns
Boolean

true if dataGridViewCell is in the DataGridViewSelectedCellCollection; otherwise, false.

CopyTo(DataGridViewCell[],Int32)

Copies the elements of the collection to the specified DataGridViewCell array, starting at the specified index.

public void CopyTo (System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell[] array, int index);
array
DataGridViewCell[]

The one-dimensional array of type DataGridViewCell that is the destination of the elements copied from the collection. The array must have zero-based indexing.

index
Int32

The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

array is null.

ArgumentOutOfRangeException

index is less than zero.

ArgumentException

array is multidimensional.

-or-

The number of elements in the DataGridViewCellCollection is greater than the available space from index to the end of array.

InvalidCastException

The DataGridViewCellCollection cannot be cast automatically to the type of array.

Insert(Int32,DataGridViewCell)

Inserts a cell into the collection.

public void Insert (int index, System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell dataGridViewCell);
index
Int32

The index at which dataGridViewCell should be inserted.

dataGridViewCell
DataGridViewCell

The object to be added to the DataGridViewSelectedCellCollection.

Exceptions
NotSupportedException

Always thrown.

Remarks

This method is not relevant for this class. You cannot change the DataGridViewSelectedCellCollection class directly. To add a cell to the DataGridViewSelectedCellCollection, use the Selected property.

Explicit Interface Implementations

ICollection.CopyTo(Array,Int32)

Copies the elements of the collection to the specified array, starting at the specified index.

void ICollection.CopyTo (Array array, int index);
array
Array

The one-dimensional array that is the destination of the elements copied from the collection. The array must have zero-based indexing.

index
Int32

The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

array is null.

ArgumentOutOfRangeException

index is less than zero.

ArgumentException

array is multidimensional.

-or-

The number of elements in the DataGridViewCellCollection is greater than the available space from index to the end of array.

InvalidCastException

The DataGridViewCellCollection cannot be cast automatically to the type of array.

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the DataGridViewSelectedCellCollection instance is cast to an ICollection interface.
